intro: Portulaca oleracea subsp. papillatostellulata, commonly known as the starry purslane, is a succulent plant characterized by its fleshy, thick stems and leaves. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. This subspecies is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in disturbed areas, such as roadsides and gardens. The plant is adapted to hot, dry environments and has a short growing season.
